help: Adds the specified amount of aptitude points to your character.
Adds a bonus granting the specified amount of extra command points to your fleet. Repeating this command will replace the previous bonus
column6: not stack with it. You can remove the bonus with the argument 'remove'.

help: Adds the specified amount of credits to your fleet's account.

Adds the specified amount of crew.
You can optionally choose an experience level for the spawned crew.
Valid levels: green, regular, veteran, and elite
Supports reversed arguments.
Adds the specified amount of fuel to your fleet's cargo.
Adds a resource to your fleet's cargo.\nIf no amount is specified, only one of that item will be given.\nSupports reversed arguments.
Adds the specified amount of marines.

Adds an officer to your fleet. You can optionally specify his or her faction, personality and starting level. If all of these are left empty, a steady level 1 officer of the player faction will be created.
Adds the specified amount of ordnance points as a bonus to all ships in the player fleet. Stacks with previous uses of this command. Use 'clear' to reset the bonus.

Tries to create a ship with the supplied variant ID and adds it to your fleet. This command is case-sensitive, but it will try with different capitalization if it fails. If an amount is given, it will spawn that many ships of that ID in your fleet. Ensure you have the required supplies!\nA ship name with no variant attached will generate an empty hull (the same result as 'addship <shipname>_Hull').\nSupports reversed arguments.
Adds the specified amount of skill points to your character.
Adds the specified amount of supplies to your fleet's cargo.
Adds a weapon to your fleet's cargo.\nIf an amount is specified, a stack of that size will be given.\nSupports reversed arguments.

Tries to create a wing with the supplied variant ID and adds it to your fleet. This command is case-sensitive.\nIf an amount is given, it will spawn that many wings of that ID in your fleet. Ensure you have the required supplies!\nSupports reversed arguments.
Adds the specified amount of experience points to your character.
Modifies the relationship between two factions by the given amount. If no second faction is entered
column6: relationship with the player is affected. Arguments range from -100 to 100.

help: Places ten thousand of every commodity in the specified station, or in storage if no argument is entered.
Places one hull of every pilotable ship in the specified station, or in storage if no argument is entered.
Places ten of every weapon in the specified station, or in storage if no argument is entered.
Places one of every fighter wing in the specified station, or in storage if no argument is entered.
Clears the text from the campaign pop-up.
Enables or disables dev mode. If no argument is given, acts as a toggle.
Ends combat with the entered side as the winner (player or enemy). No ships are damaged by this command. If no side is entered, defaults to a player victory.
Lists all campaign entities whose name contains the given arguments (not case-sensitive), as well as their current locations.

Lists all submarkets and their locations that currently sell the specified commodity or weapon. Because cargo is updated when you open the market tab, the results are not 100% accurate unless you use ForceMarketUpdate first.

Lists all submarkets and their locations that currently sell the specified ship. Because cargo is updated when you open the market tab, the results are not 100% accurate unless you use ForceMarketUpdate first.
Forces a flameout of all engines on your current target, or the player ship if no ship is targeted.
Forces an inventory refresh of all submarkets in the sector.
Toggles invincibility for all ships on your side.
Teleports your fleet to the token with the given name in this system, if any exists. The argument 'home' will function identically to the 'home' command.
Shows a list of all commands, or the details on using a specific command if one is entered as an argument.
Makes your fleet invisible to other fleets.
Teleports the player to their home location.\nHome location is set with the 'sethome' command.
Toggles infinite ammunition for all ships on your side.
Toggles CR degradation in combat.
Toggles infinite fuel for your fleet. Buying/selling and quest rewards still function normally.
Toggles infinite flux for all ships on your side.
Toggles infinite supplies for your fleet. Buying/selling and quest rewards still function normally.

Teleports your fleet to the specified system. You will be brought to that system's star (if it has one). If you want to travel to a specific token you should chain 'goto' after this command. The argument 'home' will function identically to the 'home' command.
Kills the target of the currently piloted ship.
Lists all internal IDs of a specific category for use with this mod's commands.\nValid categories: ships, variants, wings, weapons, items, factions, systems, planets, stations, markets
Lists every ship and item you have left in a storage tab, as well as their locations.
Toggles weapon cooldowns for all ships on your side.
Destroys all enemies on the battle map.
Reloads all console commands and settings.
Repairs all friendly ships on the battle map if used in combat, or all ships in your fleet on the campaign map.
Resets skills and attributes to zero and refunds all spent points.
Toggles fog of war on the battle map
column6: or gives infinite sensor range on the campaign map.

help: Forces the enemy side to order a full retreat.
Compiles and runs a line of code. This command has access to most API and LazyLib classes. Does not accept return statements.

Sets the point to be teleported to with the 'home' command.\nIf an argument is entered, the command will try to find a token with that name in the system. Otherwise, it will select a nearby object (or raw coordinates if no valid station or planet is found).
Sets the relationship between two factions to the given number. If no second faction is entered
column6: relationship with the player is affected. Arguments range from -100 to 100.

help: Toggles rendering of collision bounds, collision radius, and shield radius (if applicable) for all ships on the battle map.
Shows the coordinates of your current location.
Shows what mod a specific command came from, or all commands' sources if all is entered.
Spawns a fleet of the given size and affiliated with the specified faction near the player character. Quality affects fleet composition, and should be a number between 0 and 1.
Shows some debug information about the currently loaded commands. Adding detailed as an argument will provide much more information.

Opens the Abandoned Terraforming Platform's storage from anywhere in the campaign. If the ATP doesn't exist this command will try to find another abandoned station, or open player cargo instead as a last resort.
Kills the currently piloted ship
column6: or the entire player fleet if used on the campaign map.

help: Toggles the AI of the selected ship.
Toggles the side the selected ship will fight for.
